name: sunglass
description: Frame Material: Sunglasses frames can be made from a variety of materials, such as plastic, metal, acetate, or wood. Each material offers its own unique characteristics in terms of durability, comfort, and style.

name: sunglass
description: Lens Technology: Sunglasses lenses can come with various technologies to enhance visual clarity and protect the eyes. These technologies may include polarized lenses, which reduce glare and improve visibility, or mirrored lenses, which reflect light away from the eyes.

name: sunglass
description: UV Protection: One of the most important aspects of sunglasses is their ability to provide protection against harmful UV (ultraviolet) rays. Look for sunglasses that offer 100% UV protection to shield your eyes from both UVA and UVB rays, helping to prevent eye damage and long-term effects of sun exposure.

name: sunglass
description: Lens Tint and Color: Sunglasses lenses can come in different tints and colors to cater to various preferences and lighting conditions. Lens tints can range from dark (for bright sunlight) to lighter tints (for overcast or low-light conditions). Colors like gray, brown, green, or yellow can impact how colors appear and provide specific benefits for different activities.

name: sunglass
description: Style and Design: Sunglasses come in a wide range of styles and designs to suit different face shapes and fashion preferences. Some popular styles include aviator, wayfarer, cat-eye, round, rectangular, and sporty designs. The frame shape, color, and embellishments can significantly influence the overall look and aesthetic appeal of the sunglasses.
